djr.d3d.anim
Class SplitImage

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--djr.d3d.anim.SplitImage
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.awt.image.ImageObserver
public class SplitImage
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.awt.image.ImageObserver

This class allows to split an image in as many parts as the user decides, all of them with the same size.

Author:
(c) LuisM Pena, August-1997.

Constructor Detail

SplitImage

public SplitImage(java.awt.Image image,
                  int rows,
                  int columns)
This class splits an image in different parts.

Parameters:
image - the image to split
rows - number of images per column. It has to be greater than 0
columns - number of images per row. It has to be greater than 0
Method Detail

getHeight

public int getHeight()
              throws java.lang.InterruptedException
Gives the height of each of the splitted images.

Returns:
the height of each of the splitted images, or -1 if there has been an error (this error may have been produced in the initialization, if the number of rows of columns was not valid).
Throws:
java.lang.InterruptedException

getWidth

public int getWidth()
             throws java.lang.InterruptedException
Gives the width of each of the splitted images.

Returns:
the width of each of the splitted images, or -1 if there has been an error (this error may have been produced in the initialization, if the number of rows of columns was not valid).
Throws:
java.lang.InterruptedException

getImageProducer

public java.awt.image.ImageProducer getImageProducer(int row,
                                                     int col)
                                              throws java.lang.InterruptedException
Generates an imageProducer for the selected portion of the image.

Parameters:
row - the row of the portion. It must be a number between 0 and the number of rows - 1
col - the column of the portion. It must be a number between 0 and the number of columns - 1
Returns:
the ImageProducer generated, or null if there has been an error. The error may have been generated because (1) bad initialization, wrong number of rows or columns (2) error reading the image (3) wrong parameter in the call to the method, row and/or col are not valids
Throws:
java.lang.InterruptedException

imageUpdate

                           int flags,
                           int x,
                           int y,
                           int w,

ImageObserver Method

Specified by:
imageUpdate in interface java.awt.image.ImageObserver

checkIfStart

boolean checkIfStart()
Checks if the height and the width are already available, and -if so-, it creates the needed filters;

Returns:
true if the checking has been positive
